rev.comment: /* Criticism and controversy */ Adding Christina Elwell related information
rev.diff:
Line 174: Line 174:
Google recently settled a patent infringement lawsuit with [[Yahoo!]] by issuing 2.7 million shares. Yahoo! had earlier alleged that Google's AdSense program violated a patent held by Yahoo!'s Overture unit. The settlement cost Google around $275 million which resulted in the company posting a net loss in the third quarter of 2004.
Google recently settled a patent infringement lawsuit with [[Yahoo!]] by issuing 2.7 million shares. Yahoo! had earlier alleged that Google's AdSense program violated a patent held by Yahoo!'s Overture unit. The settlement cost Google around $275 million which resulted in the company posting a net loss in the third quarter of 2004.
  +   +
===Personal issues===
  +   +
Former Google sales executive Christina Elwell, promoted to national sales director at Google in late 2003, accused her Google supervisor of discrimination againest her [http://news.com.com/Google+hit+with+job+discrimination+lawsuit/2100-1030_3-5807158.html?tag=nl] after informing him of her pregnancy. After the lost of 3 of her quadruplets due to the stressful circumstances created by Google, now she sues the company, further refusing an offer from Shona Brown, Google Vice President, Business Operations, of reinstating her to a "low-level operations position".
===Partiality===
===Partiality===
